description: Number of different decimal digits in n-th prime.
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: The maximum is 10. Thus 1234567891 is a prime with 9 and 123456789011 with 10 different decimal digits.
prog: (Haskell)import Data.List (nub, sort)a060417 = length . nub . show . a000040-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 08 2012
author: _Labos Elemer_, Apr 05 2001
